It is a preparatory step that consumes resources without adding value to the customer or business.
This step ensures that the order is complete and ready for archiving. While it is necessary for business operations, it is not directly valued by the customer.

This step transforms the order from the active system to the archive system, directly contributing to the process of archiving the order and creating a product/service the customer is willing to pay for.
This step is necessary to determine the current status of the order and assess if cancellation is applicable. It is required by company policy but not directly valuable to the customer.
This step ensures compliance with the cancellation policy and reduces financial risk. It is necessary for business operations but not directly valued by the customer.
This step calculates the penalty amount based on the cancellation policy, directly contributing to the determination of the cancellation penalty.
This step prepares the notification to inform the customer about the cancellation penalty, directly contributing to the communication with the customer.
This step sends the penalty notification to the customer, directly delivering the information to the customer.
This step records the notification in the system for future reference and compliance purposes. While it is necessary for business operations, it is not directly valued by the customer.
This step updates the order status to cancelled, directly contributing to the cancellation process and creating a product/service the customer is willing to pay for.
This step reverses any inventory allocations made for the cancelled order, directly contributing to the inventory management process.
This step processes the cancellation penalty if applicable, directly contributing to the financial aspect of the cancellation process.
This step notifies relevant departments about the cancellation for coordination and operational purposes. While it is necessary for business operations, it is not directly valued by the customer.

substeps.description: Update system to remove cancellation request
substeps.reasoning: This step updates the system to remove the cancellation request, ensuring accurate order processing. While it is necessary for business operations, it is not directly valued by the customer.

substeps.description: Confirm continuation of order with customer
substeps.reasoning: This step confirms with the customer if they want to continue with the order, directly engaging with the customer.
This step resumes the normal order processing after confirming the continuation with the customer, directly contributing to the order fulfillment process.
